witness.translation[0].definitions[0].de: someone who sees a crime or an accident and can describe what happened

witness.translation[0].definitions[1].de: someone who appears in a court of law to say what they know about a crime or other event
witness.translation[0].definitions[1].no: witness for the prosecution/defence (also prosecution/defence witness) (=someone the prosecution or defence lawyers choose as a witness in order to help prove their case)

witness.translation[0].definitions[2].de: someone who is present when an official document is signed, and who signs it too, to say that they saw it being signed
witness.translation[0].definitions[3].de: a public statement of strong Christian belief, or someone who makes such a statement

witness.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to see something happen, especially a crime or accident
witness.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: Several residents claim to have witnessed the attack.
witness.translation[1].definitions[1].de: to experience important events or changes
witness.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: Priests have witnessed an increase in religious intolerance.
witness.translation[1].definitions[2].de: if a time or place witnesses an event, the event happens during that time or in that place
witness.translation[1].definitions[2].ex: Recent years have witnessed the collapse of the steel industry.
witness.translation[1].definitions[3].de: if you witness the signing of an official document, you are there when it is signed, and sign it yourself to prove this
witness.translation[1].definitions[4].de: to speak publicly about your Christian beliefs
witness.translation[2].definitions[0].de: someone in a court of law who tells the court what they saw or what they know about a crime
witness.translation[2].definitions[0].ex: The government’s case rested on one key (=important) witness.

the main prosecution witness (=acting to show that the accused person is guilty)
witness.translation[2].definitions[1].de: someone who is present when an official paper is signed and who also signs it to prove this
witness.translation[2].definitions[1].ex: You will need two witnesses to the signing of the document.
witness.translation[3].definitions[0].de: to be present when someone signs an official document, and to sign it yourself to show this
